sentences.en: A plague of locusts afflicted the land.
A plague on [ upon ] it [ him ]!
sentences.cn: 愿上帝降 罪 于它 ( 他)! 该死!

sentences.en: A plague on you and your damned percentages!
sentences.cn: 你和你该死的百分比都见鬼去吧！

sentences.en: drops in population levels due to plagues and famines
sentences.cn: 瘟疫和饥荒造成的人口水平下降

sentences.en: Financial problems continued to plague the company.
sentences.cn: 资金问题持续困扰着该公司。

sentences.en: I normally avoid cheap wine like the plague.
sentences.cn: 我一般对廉价的葡萄酒敬而远之。

sentences.en: Inflation will remain a recurrent plague.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀将继续成为周期性的烦扰。

sentences.en: Last year there was a plague of robbery and housebreaking.
sentences.cn: 去年抢劫和入室行窃成灾。

sentences.en: Plague was once very common here.
sentences.cn: 以前,瘟疫在这里时有发生.

sentences.en: Plague was then prevailing in that city.
sentences.cn: 当时瘟疫正在该城流行.

sentences.en: Rumours about the plague were rife.
sentences.cn: 有关瘟疫的谣传很盛行.

sentences.en: She was plagued by weakness, fatigue, and dizziness.
sentences.cn: 她被虚弱、疲劳和眩晕折磨。

sentences.en: The plague caused 100,000 deaths in London alone in the 1600s.
sentences.cn: 17 世纪，鼠疫仅在伦敦一地就造成了10万人死亡。

sentences.en: The plague has spread over many states.
sentences.cn: 瘟疫在好几个州传开了.

sentences.en: The plague once could wipe out a village.
sentences.cn: 鼠疫曾一度可以夺走整个村庄村民的生命.

phrases.tran_cn: n. 大瘟疫（指1665年流行于伦敦的鼠疫）
牛肺疫，牛传染性胸膜肺炎

trans.tran_en: a disease that causes death and spreads quickly to a large number of people
to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

trans.tran_cn: 使染瘟疫，使痛苦，造成麻烦
trans.tran_en: If you are plagued by unpleasant things, they continually cause you a lot of trouble or suffering
